info.game_comments:
2000-B College Championship semifinal game 3. 
From the University of Washington in Seattle.

(1, 1).clue: Part of a major purchase, this state entered the Union April 30, 1812

(2, 1).clue: The Bible tells us "The price of wisdom is above" these red gems, July's birthstone

(3, 1).clue: To breathe in, unlike Mr. Clinton

(4, 1).clue: A November 1999 meeting of this body abbreviated the WTO was hampered by thousands of protests

(5, 1).clue: The student newspaper of this D.C. university is the GW Hatchet

(6, 1).clue: The Beastie Boys opened for her during the 1985 Virgin Tour

(1, 2).clue: Some sources say she died in 1812, but a woman who died in 1884 claimed to be this Indian guide

(2, 2).clue: This sea-colored March birthstone is said to cure laziness, but I'm too tired to go out & buy one

(4, 2).clue: In 1988 this country's bicentennial celebration was protested by Aborigines as a "day of mourning"

(5, 2).clue: Green Mountain College is located in Poultney in this state

(6, 2).clue: "Forget About Dre" is by Dr. Dre (natch) & featuring this rapper also known as Slim Shady

(1, 3).clue: In 1812 Czar Alexander I made this city capital of Finland

(2, 3).clue: At 563 carats, the Star of India, a blue one of these September birthstones, is a bit large for a pinky ring

(3, 3).clue: One life in a series of lives

(4, 3).clue: In a 1985 protest against apartheid, many countries banned the import of Krugerrands, gold coins from this country

(5, 3).clue: An old oaken bucket goes to the winner of an annual football game between Purdue & this cross-state rival

(6, 3).clue: This group was "Headin' down the Atlanta Highway...headin' on down to the Love Shack"

(1, 4).clue: He wrote his 7th & 8th Symphonies & that famous "Immortal Beloved" letter in 1812

(2, 4).clue: People born in the purple love wearing this purple gem, February's birthstone

(3, 4).clue: Like the Pope, not capable of error in matters of doctrine or dogma

(4, 4).clue: Founding members of this 1960s group are seen here

(5, 4).clue: Angie Anderson & Carrie MacDonald are the first women to wear the Hawkeye mascot costume of this university

(6, 4).clue: (Hello, we're the Dixie Chicks)  Our song "Ready to Run" was on the soundtrack of this movie with Richard Gere & Julia Roberts

(1, 5).clue: Georges Cuvier in 1812 gave this name to the creature seen here

(2, 5).clue: The "Imperial" type of this November birthstone is highly prized for its golden hues

(4, 5).clue: Anti-war protests at the 1968 Democratic Convention in this city led to a bloody police crackdown

(5, 5).clue: Scripps & Harvey Mudd are part of this consortium of California colleges

(6, 5).clue: Salman Rushdie wrote the lyrics to "The Ground Beneath Her Feet", performed by this group

(1, 1).clue: The radio play "Under Milk Wood" is set in Llareggub in this U.K. country where Thomas was born

(2, 1).clue: To some it means everything, but to a tennis player, it means zip, nada, squat

(3, 1).clue: This country is so huge that it occupies nearly half of South America's land area

(4, 1).clue: Proverbial number that can "play at that game"

(5, 1).clue: Former Royal Ballet dancer Celia Franca founded the National Ballet of this North American country in 1951

(6, 1).clue: A common exclamation from this popular TV show is heard here("D'oh!")

(1, 2).clue: Dylan may have died as a result of this activity, defined for a male in college as having 5 in a row

(2, 2).clue: At Wimbledon 2000 she became only the  second African-American woman to win the singles title

(3, 2).clue: It's less than 55 miles from North America to Asia when you cross this strait

(5, 2).clue: The comic ballet "Offenbach in the Underworld" features dancers in hats that look like this Parisian tower

(6, 2).clue: This dramatic musical instrument heard here reached Europe in the 1700s(and a Chuck Barris program later)

(1, 3).clue: Thomas addressed the Blitz in "A Refusal to Mourn the Death, by Fire, of a Child in" this city

(2, 3).clue: (Hi, I'm Martina Navratilova and the answer is)  In 1973 Billie Jean King & Bobby Riggs played the first "Battle of the Sexes"; I played this "Bad Boy" in 1992's battle

(3, 3).clue: Poland & Lithuania are among the countries that border this sea

(6, 3).clue: The following sound is regularly heard on this TV show created by Merv Griffin(it's spinning)

(2, 4).clue: He has more Grand Slam singles titles than any other man in history

(3, 4).clue: The world's third-largest island, about 3/4 of it belongs to Indonesia

(4, 4).clue: Days of prayer in a novena

(6, 4).clue: It's the title of the following piece of music (played at military funerals)

(4, 5).clue: Syllables in a line of standard iambic pentameter

(5, 5).clue: "Lady From the Sea" is adapted from a 19th century play by this Norwegian

(0, 0).clue: As House Majority Whip, he works to get laws passed, though his name sounds like he puts them off
